intro.description: This cheat sheet helps you to open an image with fable imageviewer, and shows you how to use the highlighting tool with the file. If you have just completed the previous cheat sheet, please close all your data file parts.

item.title: Data Browsing Perspective
item.description: Please choose the data browsing perspective if you do not already have it selected (nothing will happen if you do not).

item.title: Open File
item.description: Right click on an example file from the 'data' project containing a test image, then select 'Open With', then 'Fable Image'.

item.title: Select 'Highlighting' tool
item.description: Try clicking on the button labelled 'Apply PointSpreadFunction (PSF) on the image' from the toolbar above the plot, to turn highlighting on and off. The spots should be displayed "bigger" in the highlighted image. This button may be obscured on Linux if the window containing the plot is too small.
